programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Pacers try to punch back as they host the Knicks for Game 3 of their Eastern Conference semifinal. Jalen Brunson battled through a foot injury to score 29 points as New York took a 2-0 series lead with a 130-121 victory over Indiana in Game 2.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Timberwolves try to push the defending champions to the brink as they host the Nuggets for Game 3 of their second-round series. Anthony Edwards and Karl-Anthony Towns scored 27 points apiece as Minnesota cruised past Denver 106-80 in Game 2.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: United Football League
programme.desc: The Showboats (1-5) try to keep their slim postseason hopes alive as they visit the Renegades (0-6) for a Week 7 contest. Memphis tunes up for a key Week 8 rematch with Michigan (4-2), which it still has a chance to catch in the USFL Conference.

programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Lewis vs. Nascimento - Prelims
programme.desc: Billy Ray Goff vs. Trey Waters, welterweight; Tabatha Ricci vs. Tecia Pennington, strawweight; Terrance McKinney vs. Esteban Ribovics, lightweight; Chase Hooper vs. Viacheslav Borshchev, lightweight. From Enterprise Center in St. Louis.

programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Lewis vs. Nascimento
programme.desc: Diego Ferreira vs. Mateusz Rebecki, lightweight; Alonzo Menifield vs. Carlos Ulberg, light heavyweight; Joaquin Buckley vs. Nursulton Ruziboev, welterweight; Derrick Lewis vs. Rodrigo Nascimento, heavyweight. From Enterprise Center in St. Louis.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: Headliners Vasiliy Lomachenko and George Kambosos clash for the vacant IBF lightweight world title as part of a world title tripleheader. From RAC Arena in Perth, Australia.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Cavaliers and Celtics shift their deadlocked East semifinal to the Buckeye State for Game 3. Cleveland tied the series with a commanding 118-94 Game 2 win over Boston. Six Cavs scored in double figures, including Caris LeVert's 21 off the bench.

programme.title: United Football League
programme.desc: Audi Field hosts a clash between the Defenders (3-3) and Panthers (4-2). Michigan has won back-to-back games to sit comfortably in second place in the USFL Conference. D.C. cornerback Michael Joseph leads the league entering Week 7 with 49 tackles.

programme.title: United Football League
programme.desc: An all-Texas showdown sees the Brahmas (4-2) take on the Roughnecks (1-5) in Space City. San Antonio running back John Lovett led the UFL entering Week 7 with 348 rushing yards on 74 attempts. Houston looks to put the brakes on a two-game slide.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Leading into each of ESPN's Sunday Night Baseball telecasts is this special edition of "Baseball Tonight." Host Karl Ravech teams with analysts and reporters to present fans a detailed preview of the network's exclusive, national game of the week. Highlights of the day's other games, interviews with players and managers, and key storylines from around the league also fill the hourlong show. Mark Teixeira, Eduardo Pérez, Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney are among the analysts.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Sunday evening belongs to the Braves and Mets as the NL East rivals complete a three-game series. Atlanta's Bryce Elder (1-1, 5.28 ERA) won both starts against New York last season, allowing just six hits while striking out 11 Mets in 11 1/3 innings.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Pacers host the Knicks for Game 4 of their East semifinal, down 2-1 in the series. Indiana defended home court with a back-and-forth 111-106 decision in Game 3. Tyrese Haliburton (IND) matched Donte DiVincenzo's (NY) game-high with 35 points.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: NASCAR Xfinity Racing Series
programme.desc: NASCAR Xfinity Series competitors head to South Carolina for the Crown Royal Purple Bag Project 200. Since switching to the No. 20 car for Joe Gibbs Racing, Ryan Truex has finishes of seventh, 34th and a win at the BetRivers 200, his second at Dover.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Rookie right-hander Christian Scott debuts at Citi Field as his Mets host the Braves. Scott yielded one run in 6 2/3 innings of New York's 3-1 loss at Tampa Bay on May 4 in his first MLB game. Atlanta starts veteran lefty Max Fried (2-1, 4.23 ERA).

programme.title: Road to UEFA Euro 2024 Magazine
programme.desc: Updates on the path teams must take to qualify for UEFA Euro 2024.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: Rivalry Week sees Crew SC (3-1-6) face FC Cincinnati (6-2-3) in another edition of the Hell is Real Derby. Columbus won two of three meetings in 2023, including a 3-2 extra-time decision in the Eastern Conference finals on Christian Ramírez's winner.

programme.title: United Football League
programme.desc: The Stallions (6-0) host A.J. McCarron and the Battlehawks (5-1) in a showdown of division leaders. McCarron, who played parts of seven NFL seasons with the Bengals, Raiders and Texans, has passed for 1,306 yards and a UFL-best 13 touchdown tosses.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: The Brewers host the Cardinals. Freddy Peralta looks to bounce back from his first defeat of 2024 after Milwaukee won his first six starts, including a trip to St. Louis on April 19. Kyle Gibson (STL) has authored a 1.80 ERA over his last four turns.

programme.desc: The Lady in Black hosts the NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series for the Buckle Up South Carolina 200 at Darlington Raceway. Series points leader Corey Heim earned his second win of 2024 at Kansas on May 4. Christian Eckes took the checkered flag last year.

programme.title: Inside the NBA
programme.desc: This Emmy Award-winning studio show, which airs following each NBA telecast on TNT, is hosted by Ernie Johnson, with analysis from Hall of Famer Charles Barkley and NBA champions Kenny Smith and Shaquille O'Neal. It's a mix of highlights, interviews and hijinks, notably the verbal sparring sessions between the outspoken Barkley and his straight man, Smith. The show also welcomes various guest analysts throughout the season.
